page.title: 15MEGGETLAND PLAYING FIELDS
page.content: Meggetland playing fields are the home ground for Boroughmuir Rugby Football Club, and are situated off Colinton Road beside the Union Canal. Many rugby club matches are played there and for this purpose a new pitch was dug out as the previous one had been on a slight slope, and proved to be unsatisfactory for playing Division 1 games. In 1983 a new stand was built alongside the pitch for spectators. Boroughmuir R.F.C's colours are blue and green stripes, and this is because the canal is seen as a stripe of blue against green. Cricket is played continuously all through the summer, from April to September, when the rugby season starts. The Boroughmuir R.F.C. clubhouse is situated here, and this holds many social functions, which are very popular.
